content:
⚠️ Modified the contribution.
Comment:
Added an extra test-validator pair, moved Validator 4 to Validator 5, made sure tests and validators were of similar size/difficulty.

Note: None of the answers are of the form "x.y0" (e.g. 12.20) since that would mean clashers would need to be careful about how they round to 2 decimal places (keep trailing zeroes or not).

This clash is not good enough to be allowed in Reverse.

Simply coding for ans = x*15.71/5 gives 100% on the test cases, but then only 50% on the validators.

The validators are too hard compared to the tests, they should be matching in difficulty.

Validator 4 in particular is 120 times larger than any of the tests. I think I'll have to edit this manually, as it seems like the author is not active anymore.

Come on, guys.
What programming skills one acquires solving that kind of clashes?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: You might could remove the 'input 1' test case to make it a little harder too, and I think it would still be solvable.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well everybody know the value of Pi nowadays, so why not, maybe a clearer text for Input and Output
